intro: Ardisia disticha, commonly known as the two-branched ardisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, dark red berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white and clustered in umbels, often appearing in the spring. Ardisia disticha is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
